bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: wounds and injuries of the lower extremities
wounds and injuries of the hip joint
shot fractures at the hip joint
shot fractures at the hip joint unsuccessfully treated by conservation
involved parts of joint not indicated

revisionDesc.change: additional case copied from MSHWR, performed proofing of copy and XML encoding, and key terms identified

body.p: CASE 203.—Private T. O. Tucker, Co. D, 61st Pennsylvania, aged 39 years, was wounded at SpottsylvaniaSpotsylvania, May 15, 1864, by a shell. He was taken to the field hospital of the 2d division, Sixth Corps, where Surgeon S. J. Allen, 4th Vermont, noted: "Wound of the right groin." On May 26, 1864, he was admitted into the Second Division Hospital at Alexandria. He died the following day. Surgeon T. R. Spencer, U. S. V., reported the cause of death "shot wound of the right hip joint."
